item.title: [Hyperion] Dialogues
item.dc:creator: @mhmdk mhmdk
item.description:
@mhmdk wrote:

Purpose: Adding dialogues to your Hyperion based server
Supported servers: Probably any server based of Hyperion(RS revision 317).
Assumed knowledge: Ability to think for yourself / copy+paste
Difficulty: Easy if you meet the above requirement.
Tested on: Hyperion
Classes modified/created: Dialogue, DialogueManager, NPCPacketHandler, ChatInterfacePacketHandler, Player, WalkingPacketHandler, World, ActionSender

Hi all,

After seeing so many dialogue systems that are pretty confusing. I decided to create my own
(however I do have to admit it’s based on Azure’s dialogue handler, but i modefied it to my likings :)).
This dialogue system was build for Hyperion.
So well yeah here we go!

First of all we are going to download these libs’s

[code]https://nexus.codehaus.org/content/repositories/releases/com/thoughtworks/xstream/xstream-distribution/1.3.1/xstream-distribution-1.3.1-bin.zip

(Note: you only need xstream-1.3.1.jar & xpp3_min-1.1.4c.jar)
[/code]
And add them to your project(Note: if you can’t figure out how to do that, please leave this thread!)

then we need to create some files(in: org.hyperion.rs2.model):

Dialogue.java
DialogueManager.java

And if you don’t have these files, create them(in: org.hyperion.rs2.packet):

NPCPacketHandler.java ChatInterfacePacketHandler.java

Then you enter this into: Dialogue.java

[code]package org.hyperion.rs2.model;

import org.hyperion.rs2.model.DialogueManager.DialogueType;

/**

  • Represents a single dialogue.

  • @author mafkees
    */
    public class Dialogue {

    private int id;
    private int nextDialogueID;
    private int npcID;
    private int emote;
    private DialogueType type;
    private String[] lines;

    /**

    • @param id
    •        the id to set

    */
    public void setId(int id) {
    this.id = id;
    }

    /**

    • @return the id
      */
      public int getId() {
      return id;
      }

    /**

    • @param nextDialogueID
    •        the nextDialogueID to set

    */
    public void setNextDialogueID(int nextDialogueID) {
    this.nextDialogueID = nextDialogueID;
    }

    /**

    • @return the nextDialogueID
      */
      public int getNextDialogueID() {
      return nextDialogueID;
      }

    /**

    • @param npcID the npcID to set
      */
      public void setNpcID(int npcID) {
      this.npcID = npcID;
      }

    /**

    • @return the npcID
      */
      public int getNpcID() {
      return npcID;
      }

    /**

    • @param emote
    •        the emote to set

    */
    public void setEmote(int emote) {
    this.emote = emote;
    }

    /**

    • @return the emote
      */
      public int getEmote() {
      return emote;
      }

    /**

    • @param type
    •        the type to set

    */
    public void setType(DialogueType type) {
    this.type = type;
    }

    /**

    • @return the type
      */
      public DialogueType getType() {
      return type;
      }

    /**

    • @param lines
    •        the lines to set

    */
    public void setLines(String[] lines) {
    this.lines = lines;
    }

    /**

    • @return the lines
      */
      public String[] getLines() {
      return lines;
      }
      }
      [/code]

Then you enter this into: DialogueManager.java

[code]package org.hyperion.rs2.model;

import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.logging.Level;
import java.util.logging.Logger;

import org.hyperion.rs2.util.NameUtils;

import com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream;

/**

  • Handles everything that has to do with dialogues

  • @author mafkees

  • @author BFMV
    */
    public class DialogueManager {

    private static final int CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE = 0;
    private static final int NAME = 1;
    private static final int DIALOGUE_HEAD = 2;

    private final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(this.toString());
    private static ArrayList dialogues = new ArrayList();

    /**

    • Loads all dialogues
    • @throws FileNotFoundException
      */
      @SuppressWarnings(“unchecked”)
      public void load() {
      try {
      logger.info(“Loading dialogues…”);
      XStream xStream = new XStream();
      xStream.alias(“dialogue”, org.hypnos.server.rs2.model.Dialogue.class);
      List list = (List) xStream.fromXML(new FileInputStream("./data/dialogues.xml"));
      for (Dialogue d : list) {
      dialogues.add(d);
      }
      } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
      logger.log(Level.SEVERE, “error”, e);
      } finally {
      logger.info(dialogues.size() + " dialogues loaded!");
      }
      }

    public static void showDialogue(Player player, int id) {
    player.setCurrentDialogueID(id);
    Dialogue dialogue = getDialogueByID(id);
    final int[] interfaces = new int[4];
    final String playerName = NameUtils.fixName(player.getName());
    if (dialogue != null) {
    for (int i = 0; i < dialogue.getLines().length; i++) {
    switch(dialogue.getLines().length) {
    case 1:
    if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.PLAYER_SPEAK) {
    interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 968;
    interfaces[NAME] = 970;
    interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 969;
    player.getActionSender().sendString(971, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
    } else if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.NPC_SPEAK) {
    interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 4882;
    interfaces[NAME] = 4884;
    interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 4883;
    player.getActionSender().sendString(4885, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
    }
    break;

     		case 2:
 			if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.PLAYER_SPEAK) {
 				interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 973;
 				interfaces[NAME] = 975;
 				interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 974;
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(976, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(977, dialogue.getLines()[1]);
 			} else if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.NPC_SPEAK) {
 				interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 4887;
 				interfaces[NAME] = 4889;
 				interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 4888;
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4890, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4891, dialogue.getLines()[1]);
 			}
 			break;
 		
 		case 3:
 			if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.PLAYER_SPEAK) {
 				interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 979;
 				interfaces[NAME] = 981;
 				interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 980;
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(982, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(983, dialogue.getLines()[1]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(984, dialogue.getLines()[2]);
 			} else if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.NPC_SPEAK) {
 				interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 4893;
 				interfaces[NAME] = 4895;
 				interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 4894;
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4896, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4897, dialogue.getLines()[1]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4898, dialogue.getLines()[2]);
 			}
 			break;
 			
 		case 4:
 			if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.PLAYER_SPEAK) {
 				interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 986;
 				interfaces[NAME] = 988;
 				interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 987;
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(989, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(990, dialogue.getLines()[1]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(991, dialogue.getLines()[2]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(992, dialogue.getLines()[3]);
 			} else if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.NPC_SPEAK) {
 				interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE] = 4900;
 				interfaces[NAME] = 4902;
 				interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD] = 4901;
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4903, dialogue.getLines()[0]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4904, dialogue.getLines()[1]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4905, dialogue.getLines()[2]);
 				player.getActionSender().sendString(4906, dialogue.getLines()[3]);
 			}
 			break;
 		}
 	}
 	player.getActionSender().sendDialogueAnimation(interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD], dialogue.getEmote());
 	if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.PLAYER_SPEAK) {
 		player.getActionSender().sendString(interfaces[NAME], playerName);
 		player.getActionSender().sendPlayerDialogueHead(interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD]);
 	} else if (dialogue.getType() == DialogueType.NPC_SPEAK) {
 		NPC npc = (NPC) World.getWorld().getNPCs().get(dialogue.getNpcID());
 		player.getActionSender().sendString(interfaces[NAME], npc.getCacheDefinition().getName());
 		player.getActionSender().sendNPCDialogueHead(dialogue.getNpcID(), interfaces[DIALOGUE_HEAD]);
 	}
 	player.getActionSender().sendChatInterface(interfaces[CHAT_BOX_INTERFACE]);
 }

    }

    /**

    • @return the dialogues
      */
      public ArrayList getDialogues() {
      return dialogues;
      }

    /**

    • Gets a dialogue by #ID
    • @param id
    • @return
      */
      public static Dialogue getDialogueByID(int id) {
      for (Dialogue d : dialogues) {
      if (d.getId() == id) {
      return d;
      }
      }
      return null;
      }

    public enum DialogueType {
    PLAYER_SPEAK, NPC_SPEAK
    }
    }
    [/code]

In NPCPacketHandler you add this:

[code]package org.hyperion.rs2.packet;

import org.hyperion.rs2.model.DialogueManager;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.NPC;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.World;
import org.hyperion.rs2.net.Packet;

public class NPCPacketHandler implements PacketHandler {

public static final int FIRST_CLICK = 155;

@Override
public void handle(Player player, Packet packet) {
	switch (packet.getOpcode()) {
	case FIRST_CLICK:
		handleFirstClick(player, packet);
		break;
	}
}

private void handleFirstClick(Player player, Packet packet) {
	int id = packet.getLEShort();
	NPC npc = (NPC) World.getWorld().getNPCs().get(id);
	npc.setInteractingEntity(player);
	player.face(npc.getLocation());
	player.setInteractingEntity(npc);
	if (npc != null) {
		//System.out.println("Player: " + player.getName() + ", clicked on npc #id: " + npc.getCacheDefinition().getId() + " - name: " + npc.getCacheDefinition().getName());
		switch(npc.getCacheDefinition().getId()) {
		case 1:
			DialogueManager.showDialogue(player, 0);
			break;
		}
	}
}

}
[/code]

And in ChatInterfacePacketHandler you add this:

[code]package org.hyperion.rs2.packet;

import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Dialogue;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.DialogueManager;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;
import org.hyperion.rs2.net.Packet;

public class ChatInterfacePacketHandler implements PacketHandler {

private static final int DIALOGUE = 40;

@Override
public void handle(Player player, Packet packet) {
	switch (packet.getOpcode()) {
	case DIALOGUE:
		handleDialogue(player, packet);
		break;
	}
}

private void handleDialogue(Player player, Packet packet) {
	int currentDialogueID = player.getCurrentDialogueID();
	Dialogue dialogue = DialogueManager.getDialogueByID(currentDialogueID);
	int nextDialogueID = dialogue.getNextDialogueID();
	if (nextDialogueID != -1) {
		DialogueManager.showDialogue(player, nextDialogueID);
	} else {
		player.getActionSender().sendCloseInterface();
		player.getInteractingEntity().resetInteractingEntity();
		player.resetInteractingEntity();
	}
}

}
[/code]

Add these somewhere in player.java

[code] /**
* The currentDialogueID.
*/
private int currentDialogueID;

/**
 * Sets the currentDialogueID.
 * 
 * @param currentDialogueID
 */
public void setCurrentDialogueID(int currentDialogueID) {
	this.currentDialogueID = currentDialogueID;
}

/**
 * Gets the currentDialogueID.
 * 
 * @return currentDialogueID
 */
public int getCurrentDialogueID() {
	return currentDialogueID;
}

[/code]

Open up WalkingPacketHandler (in: org.hyperion.rs2.packet) and search for:

player.resetInteractingEntity();

replace that with:

if (player.isInteracting() && !player.isInCombat()) {
			player.getActionSender().sendCloseInterface();
			player.getInteractingEntity().resetInteractingEntity();
			player.resetInteractingEntity();
		} else {
			player.resetInteractingEntity();
		}

Open up World (in: org.hyperion.model) and add this:

/**
	 * The dialogue manager.
	 */
	private DialogueManager dialogueManager;

in ‘public World() {’ you add:

backgroundLoader.submit(new Callable<Object>() {
			@Override
			public Object call() throws Exception {
				dialogueManager = new DialogueManager();
				dialogueManager.load();
				return null;
			}
		});

Now open configuration.cfg (./data/) and add this:

#	NPC first click
packetHandlers[155]: org.hypnos.server.rs2.packet.NPCPacketHandler
#	Dialogue
packetHandlers[40]: org.hypnos.server.rs2.packet.ChatInterfacePacketHandler

Allright at this point we are almost done, we only have to add a few server -> client packets. And then i will show you how easy it is to create a few dialogues.

in ActionSender you need to add this (in org.hyperion.rs2.net)

[code]public ActionSender sendDialogueAnimation(int animId, int interfaceId) {
PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(200);
bldr.putShort(animId);
bldr.putShort(interfaceId);
player.write(bldr.toPacket());
return this;
}

public ActionSender sendPlayerDialogueHead(int interfaceId) {
	PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(185);
	bldr.putLEShortA(interfaceId);
	player.write(bldr.toPacket());
	return this;
}

public ActionSender sendNPCDialogueHead(int npcId, int interfaceId) {
	PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(75);
	bldr.putLEShortA(npcId);
	bldr.putLEShortA(interfaceId);
	player.write(bldr.toPacket());
	return this;
}

[/code]

Allright we’re done with the hard part of this tutorial. Now first you have to create an XML file in:

./data/dialogues.xml

Now to create a dialogue all you have to do is add this into the XML file:

<list> <dialogue> <id>0</id> <nextDialogueID>1</nextDialogueID> <npcID>1</npcID> <emote>591</emote> <type>NPC_SPEAK</type> <lines> <string>Hello there!</string> </lines> </dialogue> <dialogue> <id>1</id> <nextDialogueID>-1</nextDialogueID> <npcID></npcID> <emote>591</emote> <type>PLAYER_SPEAK</type> <lines> <string>Hi!</string> </lines> </dialogue> </list>

id = dialogue id nextDialogueID = the next dialogue (set to -1 to end the conversation after this dialogue) npcID = the id of the NPC that uses the dialogue (you can leave it blank if it's a player_speak dialogue) emote = the animation id of the head type = the type of dialogue (NPC_SPEAK: for npc's and PLAYER_SPEAK: for players) lines: you can add up to 4 strings with text
And the last thing that you have to do in order to use the dialogues in-game is open up NPCPacketHandler
and search for:

switch(npc.getCacheDefinition().getId()) {
			case 1:
				DialogueManager.showDialogue(player, 0);
				break;
			}

to add more dialogues simply add another case(npc id) and put this into it:

DialogueManager.showDialogue(player, {the dialogue #id your using});

Thats all! Sorry for my bad english, but I tried to explain everything as good as i could.
Thank you for reading!

Now if there are any problems, or if I missed anything. Please post and I will see what I can do.

This system currently only uses dialogues with up to 4 lines of text, it shouldn’t be hard to extend this system to support more types of dialogues.

Cheers.

PS. if you are missing npc.getCacheDefinition(),
thats because I load the npc information from the cache so you will have to change that so it fits your own server.
So I’m not going to help you with that.
